title: Biate - John (Print)
description: Biate translation of the Gospel of John. The Biatah language is spoken in the Malaysian state of Sarawak and the Indonesian province of West Kalimantan. Biate is a Sino-Tibetan language spoken by the Biate people in several parts of Northeast India.

language.name: Biete
language.area: Mizoram northeast, Aizawl District, Darlawn, Ratu, New Vervek villages; Assam; Cachar Hills; Manipur; Meghalaya, Jaintia Hills District.
